If a computer needs to talk to another computer, the most efficient way would be to send the info to the other computer wirelessly. This would give the Battle droids (or at least the super smart commander droids from Star Wars: The Clone Wars TV show) the ability to adapt and respond to opposition battle tactics almost instantaneously. At this moment, we can't beat a well programmed AI at even ***Tic-Tac-Toe***, so the Trade Confederation or whoever would've been basically unstoppable if this were the case. If you have the ability to program and mass produce a functional army of robots, then you have the ability to have communicate with each other via transmitting info wirelessy. It has nothing to do with the advantages of computer based intelligence.  A modern battlefield is a much different scenario. Options B.
